> * save 20% when buying 8 patterns this pattern is available in english only and uses standard us crochet terminology ***description*** a faux-knit look with a hook the 2x2 crochet hat is worked from side to side featuring crown shaping achieved with the short row technique the extended half_double_crochet and slip_stitch pattern mimics the beloved 2x2 ribbed fabric from knitting the crochet fabric provides a thicker hat with more structure yet it is just as stylish the hat is very stretchy and is intended to be worn with 3-6 7 5-15 cm of negative ease depending on your yarn and fiber the elasticity of the fabric may change this pattern allows for an easy modification of the circumference in order to account for different elasticities like most crochethighway patterns the 2x2 crochet hat comes with step-by-step instructions and clear tutorial photos to help you complete the beanie from start to finish the pattern calls for aran weight yarn but my testers used a variety of yarn weights and colors to show off this design check out the tester lookbook on the blog to find all the details on yarns and yardages from my testers ***quick metrics from my testers *** difficulty rating 1 8 / 5 average completion time less than 5 hours ***finished measurements*** hat circumference 14 14 16 16 18 18 inches or 36 36 41 41 46 46 cm ***difficulty*** intermediate ***materials*** yarn aran or worsted weight yarn acrylic or wool blends are ideal samples shown in furls wander hook 6 mm hk or size needed to obtain gauge i m a tight crocheter so you may have to go down in hook size notions tape measure scissors darning needle 7-9 stitch markers ***yardage*** short hat 80 100 120 140 160 180 yds or 75 90 110 130 145 165 m long hat 115 145 175 200 225 250 yds or 105 135 160 185 205 230 m these yardages are estimated check out more photos yarn substitution ideas as well as the tester lookbook with exact yardages from my testers on the blog post ***how do i download my pattern *** after completing the payment check your inbox for an email containing a download link button for the pdf pattern you will need a pdf reader installed to open the pattern ***socials***
